Class Binary

java.lang.Object
  Binary
All Implemented Interfaces:
Bin
public class Binary
extends java.lang.Object
implements Bin

Class that represents Binary numbers and their operations. APCS related: Underlying implementation (int array in this example) should be able to be easily changed to a(n) ArrayList, LinkedList, String, ... The number of bits, REGISTER_SIZE, is also easily changed. Students will get practice with common "array" operations: traversing a list forwards & backwards, rotating elements, checking the values of each element, changing the values in elements, throwing exceptions, string operations (substring & concatenation), (possibly) Integer.toString, boolean flags, and modulo '%'. NON-APCS: use of 'this' to call a particular constructor. NOTES: Contains some typical student solutions and some not so typical solutions. For example: twosComplement and int2bin call each other (mutual recursion), but don't have to be written this way.

Version:
4-2-02
Author:
Kyle Gillette

          Returns the sum of two binary numbers.

          Returns the decimal value of the current Binary number.
 int getBit(int nth)
           
 Binary int2bin(int num)
          Returns the Binary number that is equivalent to the integer number given.
 Binary not()
          Returns the bitwise not representation of a binary number (1s become 0s and 0s become 1s.)
 Binary or(Binary rhs)
          Returns the bitwise or representation of two binary numbers ( 1 or 1 -> 1, 1 or 0 -> 1, 0 or 1 -> 1, 0 or 0 -> 0.)
 Binary rotateLeft()
          Returns the representation of a binary number where each bit has been move to the left one position ( a 0 is put in the rightmost position.)
 Binary rotateRight()
          Returns the representation of a binary number where each bit has been move to the right one position ( a 0 is put in the leftmost position.)
 void setBit(int nth, int value)
           
 java.lang.String toString()
          Returns the String representation of a binary number.
 Binary twosComplement()
          Returns the additive inverse value of the current Binary number (equivalent to multiplying by -1 .)
